com.groundupworks.wings

Class Wings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.groundupworks.wings.Wings

  • public final class Wings
extends java.lang.Object
    The public APIs of the Wings library. The client application must provide the dependencies via init(IWingsModule, Class[]) in its android.app.Application#onCreate().

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Wings.DefaultModule
      The default implementation of IWingsModule.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static final boolean init(IWingsModule module,
           java.lang.Class<? extends WingsEndpoint>... endpointClazzes)
        Initializer used to pass dependencies for Wings. This method must be called in the android.app.Application#onCreate().
        Parameters:
        module - the Dagger module implementing IWingsModule. Pass Wings.DefaultModule to use the default components.
        endpointClazzes - the endpoints that Wings can share to, passed as Class types.
        Returns:
        true if Wings is successfully initialized; false otherwise. Once true has been returned, calling this method will have no effect, and the return value will always be true.

      • getEndpoints

        public static final java.util.Set<WingsEndpoint> getEndpoints()
                                                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets the set of endpoint instances that Wings can share to.
        Returns:
        the set of endpoint instances.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Wings must be initialized. See init(IWingsModule, Class[]).

      • getEndpoint

        public static final WingsEndpoint getEndpoint(java.lang.Class<? extends WingsEndpoint> endpointClazz)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets the instance of a specific endpoint that Wings can share to.
        Parameters:
        endpointClazz - the endpoint Class.
        Returns:
        the endpoint instance; or null if unavailable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Wings must be initialized. See init(IWingsModule, Class[]).

      • subscribe

        public static void subscribe(java.lang.Object object)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Subscribes to link state changes of the endpoints. The subscribing Object must have one or more Subscribe-annotated methods, each taking a single parameter that corresponds to the WingsEndpoint.LinkEvent subclass of the endpoint subscribed to.

        Upon subscription, the subscriber will immediately receive an event with the current link state even though the link state did not actually change. This initial value allows the subscriber to reflect the initial link state in the ui.

        Parameters:
        object - the Object subscribing to the link state changes of the endpoints.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Wings must be initialized. See init(IWingsModule, Class[]).

      • unsubscribe

        public static void unsubscribe(java.lang.Object object)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Unsubscribes to link state changes of the endpoints.
        Parameters:
        object - the Object you wish to unsubscribe.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Wings must be initialized. See init(IWingsModule, Class[]).

      • share

        public static boolean share(java.lang.String filePath,
            java.lang.Class<? extends WingsEndpoint> endpointClazz)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Shares an image to the specified endpoint. The client is responsible for ensuring that the file exists and the endpoint is linked.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the local path to the file to share.
        endpointClazz - the Class of the endpoint to share to.
        Returns:
        true if successful; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Wings must be initialized. See init(IWingsModule, Class[]).
